filipino.text: In every forest , there is a snake.
To a person who has true humility, words are vows
A brave man will face a situation no matter how dreadful.
A broom is sturdy because its strands are tightly bound.
A clear conscience is far more valuable than money.
A clear conscience is more valuable than wealth.
A country without freedom is like a prisoner with shackled hands.
A desperate person will even hold on to a knife edge.
A diligent person will soon prosper.
A fly that lands on a carabao feels itself to be higher than the carabao.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
A good character is more valuable than gold.
A good character is real beauty that never fades.
A long voyage begins with just one step.
A monkey dressed up is still a monkey.
A person who does not remember where he/she came from will never reach his/her destination.
A person who is outwardly calm has anger raging inside.
A sincere invitation is accompanied by a pull.
A tree that bears fruit is often hurled at.
A year’s care, a minute’s ruin.
A young branch can be straightened, a mature one breaks.
Acts tough but really a wimp.
Alertness and courage are life’s shield.
All bark no bite
An intelligent monkey can still be beaten.
An intelligent monkey can still be outsmarted.
As long as there is still life, there still lies hope.
Avoiding danger is not cowardice.
Avoiding danger is not cowardice. Courage without discretion is no good.
Bad grass does not die easily.
Beauty will fade, but not goodness.
Boldness is the fruit of hope.
Borrowed clothes are either too tight or too loose.
Caution minimizes loss.
Children who get everything they ask for seldom succeed in life.
Coincidence defeats a well-laid plan.
Continues little rain drops, deep river could overflow.
Courage without discretion is no good.
Don’t count the chicken until the eggs hatch
Don’t rush things to get better results.
Don’t empty the water jar until the rain falls.
Don’t put your trust in Fortune until you are in heaven.
Don’t trust in fortune until you are in heaven.
Even if the truth is buried for centuries, it will eventually come out and thrive.
Every community has its own customs and traditions.
Every jungle has a snake – Filipino ProverbsMeaning
filipino.category: there will always be a traitor anywhere.

filipino.text: Every kind of animal can be tamed, but not the tongue of man.
Every road leads somewhere.
He who believes in hearsay does himself a disservice.
He who boasts of his accomplishments will heap ridicule on himself.
He who cackled is the guilty party.
He who does not know to look where he came from will never get to his destination.
He who does not love their national language is worse than a putrid fish.
He who gives alms to the poor faces heaven.
He who quits does not win, he who wins does not quit.
He who seeks advice seldom errs.
He who sowed wind, reaps a typhoon.
He who speaks too much works too little.
I have returned from where you are going, or the saying been there, done that.
I love cheese and Pepsi, too.
If a bamboo tube makes a loud sound, it is empty.
If it is not for there, it will never be.
If the horse is already dead more hay will not help it.
If you are going a long way, go slowly.
If you buy things you don’t need, you will soon be selling things you do need.
If you have something saved in the past, you will have something to help you in dire need.
If you like what you are doing, nothing is too far and no job is too hard.
If you make a habit of buying things you do not need, you will soon be selling things you do.
If you persevere, you’ll have stew.
If you plant, you harvest.
If you sow arrows, you will reap sorrows.
If you stash, you have something to withdraw.
If youre a playing safe person, then you’d sooner or later end up with nothing.
It is advantageous to follow advice, for you will succeed in life.
It is easier to dam a river than to stop the flow of gossip.
It is easier to pick a fruit if you go through the branches
It is easy to be born, it is difficult to be a human being.
It is easy to be human. It is hard to be humane.
It is never too late to offer anything that is good.
Laziness is the sibling of starvation.
Lazy people will eventually lose even their trousers.
Life is like a wheel, sometimes at the top, sometimes at the bottom.
Loyalty is more valuable than diamonds.
Man in need, will hold blades. – Filipino ProverbsMeaning
filipino.description: if you are deprived and needy, you will do anything even if it will cost a life.

filipino.text: Many people count other people’s faults and ignore their own.
Marriage is not just a porridge that you spit out if it’s too hot.
Mercy resides in God; deeds are in men.
No bread is too hard for warm coffee.
No child was ever born without having been conceived.
No matter how long the procession, it still ends up in church.
No matter how much care is taken, someone will always be misled.
No one looks ugly to an erect penis – Filipino ProverbsMeaning
filipino.description: there’s no immovable object, to an unstoppable force.

filipino.text: No undertaking is difficult if pursued with perseverance.
Noisy is the can that contains nothing.
Not all goodness brings sweetness.
Not all that is black is charcoal.
People who do not break things first will never learn to create anything.
Postpone today’s anger until tomorrow.
Stones hurled to the sky. Don’t get angry if you get hit.
Strength is defeated by (a strong) strategy.
Tell a lie and the truth will come to light.
Tell me who your father is, and I’ll tell you who you are.
The bitterness of studying is preferable to the bitterness of ignorance.
The child who is given everything he asks for usually won’t succeed in life.
The earth has ears, news (gossip) has wings.
The fly on the back of a water buffalo thinks that it’s taller than the buffalo.
The hardest person to wake up is the person who is already awake.
The higher the bamboo, the more it can be bent.
The noisiest drum has nothing but air inside.
The pain of the little finger is felt by the whole body.
The person who is always criticizing others is usually the one who deserves criticism the most.
The person who makes an error should be taught, and not made fun of.
The prepared beats the hardworking person.
The rattan basket criticizes the palm leaf basket, still both are full of holes.
The real hero doesn’t say that he is one.
The voluntary obedience of people depends on who is commanding them.
The wrongdoings of adults are right in the eyes of children.
There has never been a person who touched a pot without getting coal on their hands.
There is no bad food in a famine.
There is no bitter burnt rice to a hungry person.
There is no bitter crust to a hungry person.
There is no earthly bliss not watered by tears.
There’s a crocodile in every big river.
There’s no glory without sacrifice.
Thorns bury shallowly into one who walks slowly. Thorns bury deeply into one who walks fast.
To a dog a bone has more value than a pearl.
To a person who has real shame, words are oath.
To a person who has true humility, words are vows. – Filipino ProverbsMeaning
filipino.description: one must always be true to their word and keep their promises.

filipino.text: Too much bragging drives away wisdom.
Truthfulness ensures a lasting relationship.
Water can wear away even the hardest rock.
We should always keep in mind that Love, Hope, and Faith in God, will bring us success in life.
filipino.description: note: these are the three p’s of life.

filipino.text: What good is a palace if it’s inhabited by owls. Better a straw hut inhabited by humans.
What good is a something big that is still needed to be searched, if there is something small that is in your hands?
What good is grass when the horse is already dead?
filipino.description: swhat good is horse when the grass is already dead?

filipino.text: What is beauty if brain is empty.
What is the grass for if the horse is already dead.
What is the use of a palace if only an OWL lives there; a nipa hut is preferable if a PERSON lives there.
What one learns in childhood he carries into adulthood.
What you sow is what you reap.
Whatever the tree, so is the fruit.
Whatever you borrowed, return or replace it, so next time they will still lend.
Whatever you do, think about it seven times.
When there’s smoke, there’s fire
Where there is gossip, there will be arguing.
Wherever the head goes, the tail will follow.
Wherever you find sugar, you’ll find ants.
Wherever you go, habit follows.
While the blanket is short, learn to bend.
While the blanket is short, learn to curl for you to fit in it.
You still have to eat more rice.
filipino.description: you still have to learn more to outlast the opponent.

filipino.text: You work for it but others benefited from it.
He who boasts of his accomplishments will heap ridicule.
It is easier to dam a river than to stop gossip.
The rattan basket criticizes the palm-leafed bag, yet both are full of holes.
If you buy things you don’t need, you’ll soon be selling things you do.
It is easy to be born; it is difficult to be a human being.
While the blanket is short, learn how to bend.
A sleeping lobster is carried away by the current.
Marriage is not a joke. It is not like food that you can spit out when it is too hot to chew.
He who does not love his mother tongue is worse than a rotten fish.
A child that is given everything will rarely succeed in life.
He who eats chili gets burned and he who touches the pot gets charcoal on his hands.
Life is like a wheel: Sometimes you’re up, and sometimes you’re down.
The bittermelon is not yet cooked and the squash jumped in.
Poverty is not a hindrance to success.
When there’s smoke, there’s fire.
A wise man doesn’t see his foot on the ground, he watches his next step.
Of what use is the grass when the horse is already dead.
Useless labor if someone else eats from it.
Don’t count chicks until the eggs are hatched.
If you persevere, you will reap the fruits of your labor.
Knowledge is wealth that can’t be stolen.
He who is choosy often picks the worst.
Still waters run deep.
filipino.description: It a little like “don’t judge a book by its cover”. It simply means that a person may be quiet but still are very interesting once you get to know them.

filipino.text: Even a log soaked in water will burn if it is placed near a fire.
No pain, no gain.
filipino.description: If you don’t work hard, you’ll never achieve your goal.

filipino.text: Rice is wasted, even the bran.
Every pot has a matching lid.
Weeds are difficult to kill.
Nothing destroys iron but its own corrosion.
A man that talks too much accomplishes little.
A sleeping shrimp is carried away by the current.
Anything that is heavy can be light if we put our resources together.
Spend lavishly and you end up with nothing.
After the harvest, there’s no hay. (Deeds cannot be undone)
Better late than never.
filipino.description: It’s better if you do something later, than not do it at all.

filipino.text: Even though the procession is long, it will still end up in church.
He who does not look back to his origins will not reach his destination.
A debt can be paid, but a kind act cannot.
Emulate what is good; ignore what is bad.
You will know a true friend in time of need.
Barking dogs seldom bite.
You cannot pull hair from the bald.
When it rains, everyone gets wet.
Wealth can be acquired but beauty cannot.
He who waits dies, he who makes others wait lives.
No crime is left unpunished.
If it’s work, do it fast. If it’s food, eat it little by little.
The truth hurts.
Even if you put it in your mouth, it can fall out.
The tomato plant doesn’t grow mangos.
What is easily acquired is easily lost.
Opportunity only knocks once: Grab it or you’ll lose it.
If the bow is sinking, the stern follows.
New king, new character.
He who cackles laid the egg.
An empty container makes a lot of noise.
When a horse is borrowed, don’t look at its teeth .
The early comer is better than the hard worker.
Whatever you sow, you reap.
Speech is silver but silence is golden.
He who refuses advice will end up in hardship.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.
filipino.description: To be successful in life you need to settle down in one place and stop moving all the time. It also means that an active busy person will never stagnate and should prove to be productive and creative.

filipino.text: Seldom seen, soon forgotten.
Health is wealth.
No man is brave in the presence of a crying woman.
The crow will turn white and the heron black.
A quitter never wins; a winner never quits.
Strength is defeated by strategy.
Imitate the rice stalk: The more grains it bears, the lower it bows.
Different towns have different customs.
He who takes a lot of risks loses more than he can gain.
It is hard to wake up someone who is pretending to be asleep.
If a stone thrown upward hits you, don’t take offense.
Where there are flowers there are butterflies.
What goes up must come down.
Trying to get everything, you often get nothing.
It’s better to be dead and forgotten than to live in shame.
You cannot squeeze blood out if there’s none left. (said by a debtor)
There is no muddy water that doesn’t clear.
Don’t trust strangers.
United, we stand; divided, we fall.
Easier said than done.
A young tree is easy to straighten, but when it’s big it is difficult.
A clear conscience is far more valuable than wealth.
Before you point out others people’s shortcomings, correct your own first.
What comes from bubbles will disappear in bubbles.
One need not inherit wealth if he inherits good manners.
Be careful that you don’t spit on your own face.
Even if the firewood is green, it will burn when lit.
While there is life, there is hope.
A thief hates a fellow thief.
Captivating in the street, dead in the kitchen.
If someone throws stones at you, throw back bread.
If there is no patience, there will be no food.
